positions.description: Assigned to the FPS-So. FL contract as security provider at various facilities on the contract and is responsible for all aspects of security within the limits of an assigned post or facility. Verify identification of persons attempting to gain access to the facility.  Control vehicular access. Control delivery access to facility by verifying identification, bill of lading, manifest and cargo.  Conduct patrols in accordance with routes and schedules established in Post Orders.  Observe, detect, respond to and report on potential or actual security violations. Monitor post security equipment (metal detectors' X-rays CCTV).
positions.title: Pso

positions.description: I provide comprehensive security solutions. I tackle security challenges and provide security solutions. Solutions include Security officers, High Definition Video Surveillance, Access Control, Burglar and Fire Systems and Services. Providing protection and customer service to all patrons traveling on and off the Metro Rail and Metro Mover.
positions.title: Professional Protection Officer

positions.description: Served as a Security Guard to detect and prevent theft, damage, accident, trespass, sabotage and espionage and to enforce the security regulations of the installation. Conducted Random Vehicle Inspections and responded to every alarm on the installation.
positions.title: Security Guard

positions.description: Responsible for receiving merchandise and make sure that all merchandise on the invoice were received. Stack merchandise on their respective racks utilizing a forklift in occasions. Match purchase orders to sales orders and distribute to sales associates for processing. Fill requisitions, work orders or request for materials, tools or other stock items.  Place merchandise on pallets or shelves for distributions. Research orders or inventory to find merchandise. Carry out tasks as assigned by the warehouse supervisor
positions.title: Warehouse Clerk

positions.description: Small weapons & tactics training (Infantry). Patrolled areas of high-risk and conducted security for armories, ordnance depots, vehicle depots, etc. In many occasions, deadly force was authorized. Deployed to Afghanistan for âOperation Enduring Freedomâ. Verified identification through use of identification cards, badges, questioning, and other means. Conducted vehicle searches and inspections in accordance with Standard Operating Procedures. Searched and inspected vehicles (to include undercarriages), containers, personal property, and documents on commercial and governmental installations; authorized to prevent illegal entry, introduction of dangerous/prohibited items, and/or theft of government property. Maintained radio communications between the post, platoon and Battalion. Processed all types of supply requests and provided logistics support to the battalion. Recorded all equipment received in the battalionâs supply system. Supervised other warehouse clerks and delegated duties as necessary.
positions.title: Corporal
